snippet: Vegetables have been moving to the center of culinary innovation, as these takes on brussels sprouts, squash and cauliflower demonstrate.
abstract: Cooks who are ambitious yet loyal to the basic turkey are finding that vegetable side dishes can offer opportunity for adventure; many groundbreaking chefs working in the United States today have turned their focus from protein to vegetables, as can be seen in three recipe adaptations of chefs' side dishes.

byline.original: By JULIA MOSKIN and MELISSA CLARK

lead_paragraph: Vegetables have been moving to the center of culinary innovation, as these takes on brussels sprouts, squash and cauliflower demonstrate.

headline.main: Shaking Up Side Dishes With a Sense of Daring
